intro: Chaerophyllum temuloides, commonly known as the lesser cow-wheat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is a biennial or short-lived perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. The plant has a basal rosette of fern-like, pinnately compound leaves, and it produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and is often found in temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. The species is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
